meanings.definition: The quality or state of being deciduous.
meanings.sent1: The deciduousness of the trees in autumn is a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The deciduousness of the forest allows sunlight to reach the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The deciduousness of the trees makes raking leaves a seasonal chore.
meanings.sent4: Her deciduousness in changing her mind constantly is like the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The deciduousness of the trees in fall is like nature's way of shedding old memories.

meanings.definition: The shedding of leaves, petals, etc., at the end of the growing season.
meanings.sent1: In autumn, the deciduousness of the trees creates a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The deciduousness of the flowers in spring signifies the start of a new cycle.
meanings.sent3: The deciduousness of the plants in winter is like a farewell to the old year.
meanings.sent4: The deciduousness of the leaves falling is a gentle reminder of nature's rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The deciduousness of the petals drifting away is a delicate dance in the breeze.
